intro: Syntherisma hayatae, commonly known as the Japanese orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, fragrant blooms. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as mountain forests. Its leaves are elongated and grass-like, while its flowers are usually pale green or white with a subtle scent. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
